Ride a bicycle: Bicycles are a great option for traveling long distances without a car. They are environmentally friendly, cost-effective, and can be a great workout. With the rise of electric bicycles, traveling long distances becomes even more convenient. Confidence Score: 0.8

Use a motorcycle: Motorcycles are another option for traveling long distances without a car. They are faster than bicycles and can cover more distance in a shorter amount of time. Additionally, motorcycles can be more comfortable than bicycles and offer better wind protection. Confidence Score: 0.9

Take a train or bus: While public transportation may have stopped working, there are still other forms of public transportation available, such as trains and buses. These can be a reliable and efficient way to travel long distances without a car. Confidence Score: 0.7

Use a boat or ferry: For traveling along coastal areas or across bodies of water, boats and ferries can be a great option. They can provide a scenic and relaxing way to travel long distances without a car. Confidence Score: 0.8

Join a carpool or ride-sharing service: In the absence of public transportation, joining a carpool or ride-sharing service can be a great way to travel long distances without a car. This can help reduce the number of cars on the road and reduce traffic congestion. Confidence Score: 0.9
